security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill with no executable code, network calls, or file system access. It contains guidelines and protocols for using AI skills safely and effectively.

content.value_statement: Stop guessing when to use AI skills. This skill enforces disciplined skill invocation, preventing wasted time and ensuring you follow best practices. It establishes clear rules for when and how to use skills in any AI conversation.
actual_capabilities: Enforces skill invocation before any response
Provides decision flowchart for skill usage
Identifies red flags that indicate skill avoidance
Establishes priority rules for multiple applicable skills
Defines rigid vs flexible skill types
limitations: Does not execute any actual tasks itself
Requires user to have access to relevant skills

use_cases.title: Streamline complex workflows
use_cases.description: Ensure you always use the right skill for multi-step development tasks, from debugging to deployment.

use_cases.title: Standardize AI interactions
use_cases.description: Train team members to follow consistent skill protocols across all AI-assisted projects.

use_cases.title: Learn proper skill etiquette

best_practices: Always invoke skills even for simple questions - they provide context and best practices
Use process skills first to determine approach, then implementation skills for execution
Read the current skill version each time - skills evolve and improve
anti_patterns: Assuming you know better than the skill - follow instructions exactly for rigid skills
Skipping skill checks because a task seems simple - complexity often hides in simple tasks
Trying to remember skills instead of invoking them - always read the current version

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all AI platforms?
faq.answer: Yes, the principles apply to Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Platform-specific invocation methods are documented in each environment.

faq.question: What if I don't have the skills mentioned?
faq.answer: The skill helps identify what skills you need. Check your platform's skill marketplace or create custom skills for your specific needs.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my team's workflow?
faq.answer: Yes, use this skill to establish team protocols. It provides consistent guidelines for AI skill usage across team members.

faq.question: How does this ensure data safety?
faq.answer: By using appropriate skills for each task, you follow security best practices built into those skills rather than improvising potentially unsafe approaches.

faq.question: What if a skill seems wrong for my task?
faq.answer: Invoke it anyway. Skills often contain valuable context. If truly inappropriate, you can proceed without using it after reviewing.

faq.question: How is this different from general AI best practices?
faq.answer: This skill provides specific, actionable protocols for skill invocation timing and selection, not just general advice.
